Rule7: Regarding the parrot, if it has a card with a primary color, then we can conclude that it offers a job position to the starfish. Rule1 is preferred over Rule4. Rule2 is preferred over Rule7. Rule6 is preferred over Rule5. Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the viperfish offer a job to the sun bear?

The mosquito attacks the green fields whose owner is the kiwi. The panther has 13 friends. The panther is named Pablo. The polar bear prepares armor for the wolverine. The turtle has 4 friends that are lazy and four friends that are not, has a couch, and is named Blossom. The doctorfish does not offer a job to the starfish. The moose does not give a magnifier to the panther. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: If the panther has more than ten friends, then the panther does not become an actual enemy of the ferret. Rule2: Regarding the gecko, if it has a leafy green vegetable, then we can conclude that it does not know the defense plan of the donkey. Rule3: If the panther has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the donkey's name, then the panther does not become an actual enemy of the ferret. Rule4: If the moose does not give a magnifying glass to the panther but the cheetah learns elementary resource management from the panther, then the panther becomes an enemy of the ferret unavoidably. Rule5: If the gecko has a musical instrument, then the gecko knows the defensive plans of the donkey. Rule6: If the gecko has more than three friends, then the gecko knows the defense plan of the donkey. Rule7: Regarding the turtle, if it has something to sit on, then we can conclude that it does not prepare armor for the blobfish. Rule8: If something does not prepare armor for the blobfish, then it eats the food that belongs to the kangaroo. Rule9: The turtle will not eat the food of the kangaroo, in the case where the cockroach does not raise a flag of peace for the turtle. Rule10: Regarding the turtle, if it has fewer than seven friends, then we can conclude that it prepares armor for the blobfish. Rule11: If the turtle has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the crocodile's name, then the turtle prepares armor for the blobfish. Rule10 is preferred over Rule7. Rule11 is preferred over Rule7. Rule2 is preferred over Rule5. Rule2 is preferred over Rule6. Rule4 is preferred over Rule1. Rule4 is preferred over Rule3. Rule9 is preferred over Rule8. Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the turtle eat the food of the kangaroo?
proof: We know the turtle has a couch, one can sit on a couch, and according to Rule7 "if the turtle has something to sit on, then the turtle does not prepare armor for the blobfish", and for the conflicting and higher priority rule Rule11 we cannot prove the antecedent "the turtle has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the crocodile's name" and for Rule10 we cannot prove the antecedent "the turtle has fewer than seven friends", so we can conclude "the turtle does not prepare armor for the blobfish". We know the turtle does not prepare armor for the blobfish, and according to Rule8 "if something does not prepare armor for the blobfish, then it eats the food of the kangaroo", and for the conflicting and higher priority rule Rule9 we cannot prove the antecedent "the cockroach does not raise a peace flag for the turtle", so we can conclude "the turtle eats the food of the kangaroo". So the statement "the turtle eats the food of the kangaroo" is proved and the answer is "yes".

The squirrel removes from the board one of the pieces of the wolverine. The zander has a card that is blue in color. The elephant does not proceed to the spot right after the kiwi. The oscar does not knock down the fortress of the mosquito. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: Regarding the squirrel, if it has something to carry apples and oranges, then we can conclude that it knocks down the fortress of the aardvark. Rule3: If the cheetah rolls the dice for the parrot, then the parrot is not going to eat the food of the aardvark. Rule4: If the squirrel has a high salary, then the squirrel knocks down the fortress that belongs to the aardvark. Rule5: Regarding the parrot, if it has a card whose color starts with the letter "l", then we can conclude that it eats the food of the aardvark. Rule6: If the squirrel knocks down the fortress that belongs to the aardvark and the parrot does not eat the food that belongs to the aardvark, then, inevitably, the aardvark prepares armor for the sea bass. Rule7: If you see that something removes from the board one of the pieces of the wolverine but does not know the defense plan of the spider, what can you certainly conclude? You can conclude that it does not knock down the fortress that belongs to the aardvark. Rule8: If the ferret prepares armor for the rabbit, then the rabbit burns the warehouse that is in possession of the koala. Rule3 is preferred over Rule5. Rule7 is preferred over Rule1. Rule7 is preferred over Rule4. Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the aardvark prepare armor for the sea bass?
proof: We know the cheetah rolls the dice for the parrot, and according to Rule3 "if the cheetah rolls the dice for the parrot, then the parrot does not eat the food of the aardvark", and Rule3 has a higher preference than the conflicting rules (Rule5), so we can conclude "the parrot does not eat the food of the aardvark". We know the squirrel got a well-paid job, and according to Rule4 "if the squirrel has a high salary, then the squirrel knocks down the fortress of the aardvark", and for the conflicting and higher priority rule Rule7 we cannot prove the antecedent "the squirrel does not know the defensive plans of the spider", so we can conclude "the squirrel knocks down the fortress of the aardvark". We know the squirrel knocks down the fortress of the aardvark and the parrot does not eat the food of the aardvark, and according to Rule6 "if the squirrel knocks down the fortress of the aardvark but the parrot does not eat the food of the aardvark, then the aardvark prepares armor for the sea bass", so we can conclude "the aardvark prepares armor for the sea bass".
